titles.title: Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act
Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to provide for the eligibility of Transportation Security Administration employees to receive public safety officers' death benefits, and for other purposes.
Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.

committee.subcommittee: Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations
committee.name: House Judiciary

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary:
Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act
This bill amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to extend public safety officers' death benefits to Transportation Security Administration employees who are responsible for protecting the nation's transportation systems.
